p: Because Didymellaceae occurred frequently in both the canopy air and leaf spots of A. adenophora, 5 strains from the overlapped OTU14 were selected to test their virulence to native plants and A. adenophora. The disease experiments indicated that all the strains could infect A. adenophora. These strains also infected the 16 native plants tested to varying degrees. A. adenophora was more sensitive to these strains than most native plants, with the exception of R. indica ( Fig 6).
